name: Fold Draw
info:
# Part 6 of the [Visualize circuits guide.](https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/guides/visualize-circuits#)
 
# This node shows a text output rendering for drawing a quantum circuit using <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`circuit.draw()`_</font> and the <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`fold`_</font> argument. The output is the diagram in text format and sets the maximum width for the output.
```python
from qiskit import QuantumCircuit
 circuit = QuantumCircuit(1) 
for _ in range(10):
    circuit.h(0)
# limit line length to 40 characters
circuit.draw(output="text", fold=40)
```

name: Scale Draw
info:
# Part 8 of the [Visualize circuits guide.](https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/guides/visualize-circuits#)
 
# This node shows a text output rendering for drawing a quantum circuit using <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`circuit.draw()`_</font> and the <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`scale`_</font> argument. The output is a diagram with the mpl renderer with a scaled output.
```python
from qiskit import QuantumCircuit
 circuit = QuantumCircuit(1) 
for _ in range(10):
    circuit.h(0)
# Scale the mpl output to 1/2 the normal size
circuit.draw(output="mpl", scale=0.5)
```

name: Style Draw
info:
# Part 7 of the [Visualize circuits guide.](https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/guides/visualize-circuits#)
 
# This node shows a text output rendering for drawing a quantum circuit using <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`circuit.draw()`_</font> and the <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`style`_</font> argument. The output is a diagram using the mpl renderer and changes to the colors and outlines.
```python
from qiskit import QuantumCircuit
 circuit = QuantumCircuit(1) 
for _ in range(10):
    circuit.h(0)
# limit line length to 40 characters
style = {"backgroundcolor": "lightgreen"}
circuit.draw(output="mpl", style=style)
```

name: Standalone Draw
info:
# Part 9 of the [Visualize circuits guide.](https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/guides/visualize-circuits#)
 
# This node shows a text output rendering for drawing a quantum circuit using the <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`circuit_drawer()`_</font> function instead of the and the <font style='background: lightgrey'>_`circuit.draw()`_</font> method. The function behaves identically to the method, except that it takes in a circuit object as a required argument.
```python
from qiskit import QuantumCircuit
from qiskit.visualization import circuit_drawer
 circuit = QuantumCircuit(1) 
for _ in range(10):
    circuit.h(0)
circuit_drawer(circuit, output="mpl", plot_barriers=False)
```
